text: Sir Colin Earl Meads (3 June 1936 â€“ 20 August 2017) was a New Zealand rugby union player, coach and manager. == Early life and Career == He was born in Cambridge, New Zealand. He played 55 test matches (133 total games), most frequently in the lock forward position, for New Zealand's national team, the All Blacks, from 1957 until 1971. Nicknamed 'Pinetree', he was an icon within New Zealand rugby, and was named the country's Player of the Century at the NZRFU Awards in 1999. Meads died on 20 August 2017 in Te Kuiti, New Zealand of pancreatic cancer at the age of 81. ==References== ==Other websites== *NZ Rugby Museum profile *Player listing from Planet Rugby Category:1936 births Category:2017 deaths Category:New Zealand rugby union coaches Category:New Zealand rugby union players Category:Sportspeople from North Island
title: Colin Meads
